gov.sandia.cognition.learning.algorithm.root

Class RootBracketExpander

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.sandia.cognition.util.AbstractCloneableSerializable
      • gov.sandia.cognition.algorithm.AbstractIterativeAlgorithm
        • gov.sandia.cognition.algorithm.AbstractAnytimeAlgorithm<ResultType>
          • gov.sandia.cognition.learning.algorithm.AbstractAnytimeBatchLearner<Evaluator<java.lang.Double,java.lang.Double>,LineBracket>
            • gov.sandia.cognition.learning.algorithm.root.RootBracketExpander
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AnytimeAlgorithm<LineBracket>, IterativeAlgorithm, StoppableAlgorithm, AnytimeBatchLearner<Evaluator<java.lang.Double,java.lang.Double>,LineBracket>, BatchLearner<Evaluator<java.lang.Double,java.lang.Double>,LineBracket>, RootBracketer, CloneableSerializable, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable

    public class RootBracketExpander
extends AbstractAnytimeBatchLearner<Evaluator<java.lang.Double,java.lang.Double>,LineBracket>
implements RootBracketer
    The root-bracketing expansion algorithm. This function repeatedly expands a root bracket about an initial guess until it finds a region where it can be demonstrated that the function makes a zero-crossing (root). The algorithm can fail on functions where the function "kisses" zero, or has a "notch" type look.
    Since:
    3.0
    Author:
    Kevin R. Dixon
    See Also:
    Serialized Form
